intro: Tristagma dimorphopetalum, commonly known as the two-petaled tristagma, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is a member of the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant produces showy, pink to purple flowers with two distinct petals, a unique feature that gives it its scientific name. It typically grows in rocky soils and is adapted to arid environments.
